title: U.S. Virgin Islands Races to Close Rum-Bond Refinancing to Save Pension
sub_head: The proposed refinancing is designed to head off insolvency of the U.S. territory’s civil-servant pension system
body:
The U.S. Virgin Islands is racing to sell its rum-tax collections to bondholders ahead of expected interest-rate hikes, pitching an $890 million debt refinancing as the answer to a government pension system’s looming insolvency.
The Virgin Islands legislature said it approved the planned refinancing on Monday, clearing the way for a proposed deal to refinance outstanding rum-tax bonds maturing over the next two decades with new securitization debt.
